item.title: Cheminformatics tools in R
item.description: What are the tools available in R for Cheminformatics? R has garnered some attention as the preferred programming language for statistical computing and one of the the leading programming languages for machine learning. With wide use in academia and projects like the Bioconductor project it is definitely a good environment in which to produce serious research in bioinformatics. Within bioinformatics there is often the need to represent chemical structures. In this blogpost I do a quick tour of the tools available for cheminformatics in R.
